meanings.definition: Remove (something written or drawn) by wiping or scraping it away.
meanings.sent1: I will erase the mistake on my paper with an eraser.
meanings.sent2: Please erase the incorrect answer and write the correct one.
meanings.sent3: He tried to erase his name from the board, but it kept smudging.
meanings.sent4: Her tears seemed to erase the ink of his harsh words from her heart.
meanings.sent5: The wind and rain worked together to erase the sandcastle from the beach.

meanings.definition: Remove all traces of; destroy or obliterate.
meanings.sent1: The detective needed to erase all evidence of the crime scene.
meanings.sent2: They wanted to erase any memory of the embarrassing incident.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick was to erase the rabbit from the hat completely.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to erase the pain of the past, leaving only faint scars.
meanings.sent5: The artist used a brush to carefully erase the pencil sketch from the canvas.
